trans-unit.source: The SystemMediaTransportControls class enables your app to use the system media transport controls that are built into Windows and to update the metadata that the controls display about the media your app is currently playing.
trans-unit.target: The SystemMediaTransportControls class enables your app to use the system media transport controls that are built into Windows and to update the metadata that the controls display about the media your app is currently playing.

trans-unit.source: System Media Transport Controls
trans-unit.target: System Media Transport Controls

trans-unit.source: System Media Transport Controls
trans-unit.target: System Media Transport Controls

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: The [**SystemMediaTransportControls**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278677) class enables your app to use the system media transport controls that are built into Windows and to update the metadata that the controls display about the media your app is currently playing.
trans-unit.target: The [**SystemMediaTransportControls**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278677) class enables your app to use the system media transport controls that are built into Windows and to update the metadata that the controls display about the media your app is currently playing.

trans-unit.source: The system transport controls are different than the transport controls on the [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) object.
trans-unit.target: The system transport controls are different than the transport controls on the [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) object.

trans-unit.source: The system transport controls are the controls that pop up when hardware media keys are pressed, such as the volume control on a pair of headphones or the media buttons on keyboards.
trans-unit.target: The system transport controls are the controls that pop up when hardware media keys are pressed, such as the volume control on a pair of headphones or the media buttons on keyboards.

trans-unit.source: If the user presses the pause key on a keyboard and your app supports the [**SystemMediaTransportControls**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278677), your app is notified and you can take the appropriate action.
trans-unit.target: If the user presses the pause key on a keyboard and your app supports the [**SystemMediaTransportControls**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278677), your app is notified and you can take the appropriate action.

trans-unit.source: Your app can also update the media info, such as the song title and thumbnail image that the [**SystemMediaTransportControls**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278677) displays.
trans-unit.target: Your app can also update the media info, such as the song title and thumbnail image that the [**SystemMediaTransportControls**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278677) displays.

trans-unit.source: Note
trans-unit.target: Note

trans-unit.source: The [System Media Transport Controls UWP sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=619488) implements the code discussed in this overview.
trans-unit.target: The [System Media Transport Controls UWP sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=619488) implements the code discussed in this overview.

trans-unit.source: You can download the sample to see the code in context or to use as a starting point for your own app.
trans-unit.target: You can download the sample to see the code in context or to use as a starting point for your own app.

trans-unit.source: Set up transport controls
trans-unit.target: Set up transport controls

trans-unit.source: In the page's XAML file, define a [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) that will be controlled by the system media transport controls.
trans-unit.target: In the page's XAML file, define a [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) that will be controlled by the system media transport controls.

trans-unit.source: The [**CurrentStateChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227375) and [**MediaOpened**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227394) events are used to update the system media transport controls and will be discussed later in this article.
trans-unit.target: The [**CurrentStateChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227375) and [**MediaOpened**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227394) events are used to update the system media transport controls and will be discussed later in this article.

trans-unit.source: MediaElementSystemMediaTransportControls
trans-unit.target: MediaElementSystemMediaTransportControls

trans-unit.source: Add a button to the XAML file that allows the user to select a file to play.
trans-unit.target: Add a button to the XAML file that allows the user to select a file to play.

trans-unit.source: OpenButton
trans-unit.target: OpenButton

trans-unit.source: In your code behind page, add using directives for the following namespaces.
trans-unit.target: In your code behind page, add using directives for the following namespaces.

trans-unit.source: Namespace
trans-unit.target: Namespace

trans-unit.source: Add a button click handler that uses a [**FileOpenPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207847) to allow the user to select a file, then call [**SetSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br244338) to make it the active file for the **MediaElement**.
trans-unit.target: Add a button click handler that uses a [**FileOpenPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207847) to allow the user to select a file, then call [**SetSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br244338) to make it the active file for the **MediaElement**.

trans-unit.source: OpenMediaFile
trans-unit.target: OpenMediaFile

trans-unit.source: Get an instance of the [**SystemMediaTransportControls**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278677) by calling [**GetForCurrentView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278708).
trans-unit.target: Get an instance of the [**SystemMediaTransportControls**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278677) by calling [**GetForCurrentView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278708).

trans-unit.source: Enable the buttons that your app will use by setting the corresponding "is enabled" property of the **SystemMediaTransportControls** object, such as [**IsPlayEnabled**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278714), [**IsPauseEnabled**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278713), [**IsNextEnabled**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278712), and [**IsPreviousEnabled**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278715).
trans-unit.target: Enable the buttons that your app will use by setting the corresponding "is enabled" property of the **SystemMediaTransportControls** object, such as [**IsPlayEnabled**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278714), [**IsPauseEnabled**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278713), [**IsNextEnabled**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278712), and [**IsPreviousEnabled**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278715).

trans-unit.source: See the **SystemMediaTransportControls** reference documentation for a complete list of available controls.
trans-unit.target: See the **SystemMediaTransportControls** reference documentation for a complete list of available controls.

trans-unit.source: Register a handler for the [**ButtonPressed**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278706) event to receive notifications when the user presses a button.
trans-unit.target: Register a handler for the [**ButtonPressed**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278706) event to receive notifications when the user presses a button.

trans-unit.source: SystemMediaTransportControlsSetup
trans-unit.target: SystemMediaTransportControlsSetup

trans-unit.source: Handle system media transport controls button presses
trans-unit.target: Handle system media transport controls button presses

trans-unit.source: The [**ButtonPressed**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278706) event is raised by the system transport controls when one of the enabled buttons is pressed.
trans-unit.target: The [**ButtonPressed**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278706) event is raised by the system transport controls when one of the enabled buttons is pressed.

trans-unit.source: The [**Button**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278685) property of the [**SystemMediaTransportControlsButtonPressedEventArgs**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278683) passed into the event handler is a member of the [**SystemMediaTransportControlsButton**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278681) enumeration that indicates which of the enabled buttons was pressed.
trans-unit.target: The [**Button**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278685) property of the [**SystemMediaTransportControlsButtonPressedEventArgs**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278683) passed into the event handler is a member of the [**SystemMediaTransportControlsButton**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278681) enumeration that indicates which of the enabled buttons was pressed.

trans-unit.source: In order to update objects on the UI thread from the [**ButtonPressed**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278706) event handler, such as a [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) object, you must marshal the calls through the [**CoreDispatcher**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208211).
trans-unit.target: In order to update objects on the UI thread from the [**ButtonPressed**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278706) event handler, such as a [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) object, you must marshal the calls through the [**CoreDispatcher**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208211).

trans-unit.source: This is because the **ButtonPressed** event handler is not called from the UI thread and therefore an exception will be thrown if you attempt to modify the UI directly.
trans-unit.target: This is because the **ButtonPressed** event handler is not called from the UI thread and therefore an exception will be thrown if you attempt to modify the UI directly.

trans-unit.source: SystemMediaTransportControlsButtonPressed
trans-unit.target: SystemMediaTransportControlsButtonPressed

trans-unit.source: Update the system media transport controls with the current media status
trans-unit.target: Update the system media transport controls with the current media status

trans-unit.source: You should notify the [**SystemMediaTransportControls**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278677) when the state of the media has changed so that the system can update the controls to reflect the current state.
trans-unit.target: You should notify the [**SystemMediaTransportControls**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278677) when the state of the media has changed so that the system can update the controls to reflect the current state.

trans-unit.source: To do this, set the [**PlaybackStatus**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278719) property to the appropriate [**MediaPlaybackStatus**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278665) value from within the [**CurrentStateChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227375) event of the [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926), which is raised when the media state changes.
trans-unit.target: To do this, set the [**PlaybackStatus**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278719) property to the appropriate [**MediaPlaybackStatus**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278665) value from within the [**CurrentStateChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227375) event of the [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926), which is raised when the media state changes.

trans-unit.source: SystemMediaTransportControlsStateChange
trans-unit.target: SystemMediaTransportControlsStateChange

trans-unit.source: Update the system media transport controls with media info and thumbnails
trans-unit.target: Update the system media transport controls with media info and thumbnails

trans-unit.source: Use the [**SystemMediaTransportControlsDisplayUpdater**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278686) class to update the media info that is displayed by the transport controls, such as the song title or the album art for the currently playing media item.
trans-unit.target: Use the [**SystemMediaTransportControlsDisplayUpdater**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278686) class to update the media info that is displayed by the transport controls, such as the song title or the album art for the currently playing media item.

trans-unit.source: Get an instance of this class with the [**SystemMediaTransportControls.DisplayUpdater**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278707) property.
trans-unit.target: Get an instance of this class with the [**SystemMediaTransportControls.DisplayUpdater**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278707) property.

trans-unit.source: For typical scenarios, the recommended way to pass the metadata is to call [**CopyFromFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278694), passing in the currently playing media file.
trans-unit.target: For typical scenarios, the recommended way to pass the metadata is to call [**CopyFromFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278694), passing in the currently playing media file.

trans-unit.source: The display updater will automatically extract the metadata and thumbnail image from the file.
trans-unit.target: The display updater will automatically extract the metadata and thumbnail image from the file.

trans-unit.source: Call the [**Update**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278701) to cause the system media transport controls to update its UI with the new metadata and thumbnail.
trans-unit.target: Call the [**Update**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278701) to cause the system media transport controls to update its UI with the new metadata and thumbnail.

trans-unit.source: SystemMediaTransportControlsUpdater
trans-unit.target: SystemMediaTransportControlsUpdater

trans-unit.source: If your scenario requires it, you can update the metadata displayed by the system media transport controls manually by setting the values of the [**MusicProperties**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278696), [**ImageProperties**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278695), or [**VideoProperties**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278702) objects exposed by the [**DisplayUpdater**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278707) class.
trans-unit.target: If your scenario requires it, you can update the metadata displayed by the system media transport controls manually by setting the values of the [**MusicProperties**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278696), [**ImageProperties**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278695), or [**VideoProperties**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278702) objects exposed by the [**DisplayUpdater**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278707) class.

trans-unit.source: SystemMediaTransportControlsUpdaterManual
trans-unit.target: SystemMediaTransportControlsUpdaterManual

trans-unit.source: Update the system media transport controls timeline properties
trans-unit.target: Update the system media transport controls timeline properties

trans-unit.source: The system transport controls display information about the timeline of the currently playing media item, including the current playback position, the start time, and the end time of the media item.
trans-unit.target: The system transport controls display information about the timeline of the currently playing media item, including the current playback position, the start time, and the end time of the media item.

trans-unit.source: To update the system transport controls timeline properties, create a new [**SystemMediaTransportControlsTimelineProperties**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt218746) object.
trans-unit.target: To update the system transport controls timeline properties, create a new [**SystemMediaTransportControlsTimelineProperties**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt218746) object.

trans-unit.source: Set the properties of the object to reflect the current state of the playing media item.
trans-unit.target: Set the properties of the object to reflect the current state of the playing media item.

trans-unit.source: Call [**SystemMediaTransportControls.UpdateTimelineProperties**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt218760) to cause the controls to update the timeline.
trans-unit.target: Call [**SystemMediaTransportControls.UpdateTimelineProperties**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt218760) to cause the controls to update the timeline.

trans-unit.source: UpdateTimelineProperties
trans-unit.target: UpdateTimelineProperties

trans-unit.source: You must provide a value for the [**StartTime**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt218751), [**EndTime**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt218747) and [**Position**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt218755) in order for the system controls to display a timeline for your playing item.
trans-unit.target: You must provide a value for the [**StartTime**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt218751), [**EndTime**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt218747) and [**Position**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt218755) in order for the system controls to display a timeline for your playing item.

trans-unit.source: [**MinSeekTime**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt218749) and [**MaxSeekTime**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt218748) allow you to specify the range within the timeline that the user can seek.
trans-unit.target: [**MinSeekTime**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt218749) and [**MaxSeekTime**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt218748) allow you to specify the range within the timeline that the user can seek.

trans-unit.source: A typical scenario for this is to allow content providers to include advertisement breaks in their media.
trans-unit.target: A typical scenario for this is to allow content providers to include advertisement breaks in their media.

trans-unit.source: You must set [**MinSeekTime**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt218749) and [**MaxSeekTime**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt218748) in order for the [**PositionChangeRequest**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt218755) to be raised.
trans-unit.target: You must set [**MinSeekTime**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt218749) and [**MaxSeekTime**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt218748) in order for the [**PositionChangeRequest**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt218755) to be raised.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that you keep the system controls in sync with your media playback by updating these properties approximately every 5 seconds during playback and again whenever the state of playback changes, such as pausing or seeking to a new position.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended that you keep the system controls in sync with your media playback by updating these properties approximately every 5 seconds during playback and again whenever the state of playback changes, such as pausing or seeking to a new position.

trans-unit.source: Respond to player property changes
trans-unit.target: Respond to player property changes

trans-unit.source: There is a set of system transport controls properties that relate to the current state of the media player itself, rather than the state of the playing media item.
trans-unit.target: There is a set of system transport controls properties that relate to the current state of the media player itself, rather than the state of the playing media item.

trans-unit.source: Each of these properties is matched with an event that is raised when the user adjusts the associated control.
trans-unit.target: Each of these properties is matched with an event that is raised when the user adjusts the associated control.

trans-unit.source: These properties and events include:
trans-unit.target: These properties and events include:

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Event
trans-unit.target: Event

trans-unit.source: AutoRepeatMode
trans-unit.target: AutoRepeatMode

trans-unit.source: AutoRepeatModeChangeRequested
trans-unit.target: AutoRepeatModeChangeRequested

trans-unit.source: PlaybackRate
trans-unit.target: PlaybackRate

trans-unit.source: PlaybackRateChangeRequested
trans-unit.target: PlaybackRateChangeRequested

trans-unit.source: ShuffleEnabled
trans-unit.target: ShuffleEnabled

trans-unit.source: ShuffleEnabledChangeRequested
trans-unit.target: ShuffleEnabledChangeRequested

trans-unit.source: To handle user interaction with one of these controls, first register a handler for the associated event.
trans-unit.target: To handle user interaction with one of these controls, first register a handler for the associated event.

trans-unit.source: RegisterPlaybackChangedHandler
trans-unit.target: RegisterPlaybackChangedHandler

trans-unit.source: In the handler for the event, first make sure that the requested value is within a valid and expected range.
trans-unit.target: In the handler for the event, first make sure that the requested value is within a valid and expected range.

trans-unit.source: If it is, set the corresponding property on [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) and then set the corresponding property on the [**SystemMediaTransportControls**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278677) object.
trans-unit.target: If it is, set the corresponding property on [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) and then set the corresponding property on the [**SystemMediaTransportControls**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278677) object.

trans-unit.source: PlaybackChangedHandler
trans-unit.target: PlaybackChangedHandler

trans-unit.source: In order for one of these player property events to be raised, you must set an initial value for the property.
trans-unit.target: In order for one of these player property events to be raised, you must set an initial value for the property.

trans-unit.source: For example, [**PlaybackRateChangeRequested**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt218757) will not be raised until after you have set a value for the [**PlaybackRate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt218756) property at least one time.
trans-unit.target: For example, [**PlaybackRateChangeRequested**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt218757) will not be raised until after you have set a value for the [**PlaybackRate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt218756) property at least one time.

trans-unit.source: Use the system media transport controls for background audio
trans-unit.target: Use the system media transport controls for background audio

trans-unit.source: To use the system media transport controls for background audio, you must enable the play and pause buttons by setting [**IsPlayEnabled**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278714) and [**IsPauseEnabled**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278713) to true.
trans-unit.target: To use the system media transport controls for background audio, you must enable the play and pause buttons by setting [**IsPlayEnabled**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278714) and [**IsPauseEnabled**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278713) to true.

trans-unit.source: Your app must also handle the [**ButtonPressed**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278706) event.
trans-unit.target: Your app must also handle the [**ButtonPressed**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278706) event.

trans-unit.source: To get an instance of [**SystemMediaTransportControls**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278677) from within your app's background task, you must use [**BackgroundMediaPlayer.Current.SystemMediaTransportControls**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926635) instead of [**GetForCurrentView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278708), which can only be used from within your foreground app.
trans-unit.target: To get an instance of [**SystemMediaTransportControls**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278677) from within your app's background task, you must use [**BackgroundMediaPlayer.Current.SystemMediaTransportControls**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926635) instead of [**GetForCurrentView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278708), which can only be used from within your foreground app.

trans-unit.source: For more information on playing audio in the background, see [Background audio](background-audio.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on playing audio in the background, see [Background audio](background-audio.md).
